response:
MRI is the gold standard to visualise inflammation in the optic nerve and detect demyelinating plaques in the brain and spine (dissemination in space). Lumbar puncture is indicated to look for oligoclonal bands (inflammatory markers). A comprehensive blood panel is required to rule out mimics like NMO, MOGAD, vasculitis, and infections.

investigations = ["MRI of Brain and Spinal Cord with contrast", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum B12 and folate", "Thyroid function tests", "Serum glucose", "Serum ACE", "Serum AQP4 antibodies", "Serum MOG antibodies", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA, dsDNA)", "Syphilis serology", "HIV serology", "Lumbar Puncture", "Visual Evoked Potentials", "Optical Coherence Tomography"]
